situation.title: Symptoms
situation.meta_description: What are the symptoms of COVID-19?

content.processed:
Common symptoms of the disease include:

  • Temperature 37.3 °C and above
  • Cough
  • Difficulty with breathing
  • Sore throat, headache, backache, muscles ache or joints ache
  • Loss of smell/taste
  • Fatigue
  • Diarrhoea
  • Nausea
  • Rhinitis
  • Children may experience so-called "COVID fingers"

If you experience symptoms of COVID-19, contact your GP by phone and stay at home.

questions_answers.question: How many infected people do not have any symptoms at all?
questions_answers.value: Researches say that up to 20% of people do not experience any symptoms of the COVID-19. Even though these people do not feel ill or infected, they are still dangerous to others. These people are still spreading the virus around and can easily infect others.
